title: Karma Passive/Ult Discussion. Red Response Requested
body:
Currently Karma has a passive that can easily be frontloaded onto her R ability to give her kit more options. The auto attack/spell damage is centric to her R anyway, so imo it would make a lot more sense to combine the two and free up a passive, so that you can make a small change to her without removing her awesome 3 skill 1 mantra style of play.

An _**example**_ of a passive could be:

**INSTANT KARMA: ** 5%/7.5%/10% of damage dealt to karma by champions is stored for the next 4 seconds. this amount can be discharged by auto attacking. After 4 seconds, this value is added to karmas mana pool.


Something like this would help solidify 'good karmas' from 'bad karmas' -- This is just an example however. My primary suggestion is that her R and Passive be combined.

Thank you for reading.

I main {{champion:43}} (not to say my opinion is any more valuable/informative than yours, but rather that after a while, I can sort of see explanations as to why people don't play her anymore), and I must say, after a while, she does get relatively boring. The thing that's always frustrated me the most about her is her ultimate, Mantra. It's not that it's a bad idea, but since early game, it's so hard to get, you have to save it. You have to save it, even though your passive is supposed to help you get it more. But damn, it's hard to land those AAs to actually restore it, even when you stun your opponents. More than likely, they are either: Mobile enough to escape, have flash, or can counter-all-in you. And honestly, if she was not so dependent on her ultimate, I wouldn't complain. But considering the fact that she is literally one of the only champions in the game who cannot hardly do anything without her ultimate, it makes her pretty damn boring whilst waiting for it to come back up, thus making you feel obligated to save it for whenever you might specifically need it, thus making you literally play a minima of waiting... waiting for the ideal opportunity to go in... waiting, and waiting, and waiting...

At least she keeps busy while she waits!

My point exactly! XD
I think she should get more AP the less health she has. Really fits her balance theme. Kappa.

But having higher AP with lower HP is, to paraphrase Riot "extremely toxic since you feel punished for playing well - by dealing damage to her, which you should do, you give her more power". That is, it's extremely toxic unless you happen to be named after one of the big heads in Riot - then you can have this kind of ability. And have it boosted by a RNG passive. And be able to stay at lowest possible HP for 5 seconds so you can properly (ab)use it.
I doubt they'd do flat ap, but perhaps they could let her have a little bonus damage based on her missing hp. That wouldn't be unfair, not by the game's current standards.

tbh The real annoyance about the damage removal is that its literally the only Mantra she has that doesn't directly feed back into itself.
Renewal caps at a 9s refund if you fulfill it, and if you somehow manage to hit all 5 enemies with both procs of her Soulflare, that's a massive 30s cd refund max (3s x 5 targets x 2 hits). If Defiance even had 1damage on it, then it'd be able to feed back into itself, and would make using her E2 much more lucrative, as you'd be able to set up for followup mantras much easier.

A simpler option would just be to make her passive refund CD for each *ally* hit by R+E.  It's fine, even good, for her other ults to have uses besides "and do some damage".  But the lack of ability to trigger her passive is unfortunate.

On the other hand, even if you're *ulting* E you're probably still going to *cast* her other spells; so you still do have opportunities to proc her passive.  Maybe the logic is that R+E doesn't trigger her passive because regular E doesn't, and R+Q and R+W do because regular Q and W do.  So which spell you choose to ult isn't going to affect your speed of getting another ult one way or the other.

One idea that might be interesting is having ult spells have separate CD, so you can use the regular and ult version in the same combo, like Rengar.  The potential CC chain from WRW/RWW would be scary, possibly even on a level with Leblanc's ER (but Karma is not nearly as safe because she doesn't have Leblanc's W2).

I could see the ally proc working, i just suggested the 1damage because it wouldn't have to mess with how her passive's coding works. Having seperate Cooldowns on her Mantras as opposed to their standard variants would make her really dynamic, so +1 to that idea.

It would help her a bit more in that department though, honestly I think Karma is fine; Riot kinda has a fetish for changing her often though.

I think there should be an emphasis on combining her spells together; since chaining her spells is integral to her kit. 

W+Q hitting the enemy with Q immediately triggers the root, and deals bonus damage. If the tethered enemy is hit with a Mantra Q, they are stunned.

W+E if a tethered enemy attempts to hit a shielded ally, they lose movement/attack speed . If it's a RE, it redirects a portion of the damage to the enemy.

Q+E if a shielded ally is in the damage radius of the Q, they gain a buff that allows their basic attacks to trigger Karma's passive. If its a RQ+E, the secondary explosion refreshes the shield value on the ally.
That could be a thing for an upcoming champion. Karma's kit itself is already in an ok spot. A slight passive change could be the cherry on top which she could use of.
